intro: Scabiosa pterocephala, commonly known as the winged scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, winged petals that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom from late spring to early autumn. Scabiosa pterocephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to attract pollinators.
